fields.value: The implementation and evaluation of an e-Learning training module for observed structured  clinical examination (OSCE) raters in Canada

authorAffiliation.value: Division of Hematology, The Ottawa Hospital
Division of General Internal Medicine, The Ottawa Hospital
Division of General Internal Medicine, The Ottawa Hospital

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Division of Hematology, The Ottawa Hospital

dsDescriptionValue.value: The purpose of this study was to evaluate an e-Learning training module for OSCE raters who participated in the assessment of third-year medical students at the University of Ottawa, Canada.  The effects of online training and those of traditional in-person (face-to-face) orientation were compared. Of the 90 physicians recruited as raters for this OSCE, 60 consented to participate (67.7%) in the study in March 2017. Of the 60 participants, 55 rated students during the OSCE, while the remaining 5 were back-up raters.

keywordValue.value: Evaluation, Observed structured clinical examination, Medical education, e-Learning, Canada
